fields.description:
As a user of the Eucalyptus Management Console I would like to see alarm thresholds visible in CloudWatch charts so that I can see if any metrics approach or cross that threshold in order to better monitor my resources.

This ticket applies only to charts that are displayed in the context of a particular alarm,  such as create alarm, alarm details, copy alarm
fields.summary: Incorporate alarm thresholds in CloudWatch charts

comments.body: [~jloza]: We should be able to implement this fairly quickly if we limit the scope of this ticket to the alarm details page, and it won't be blocked by GUI-2544.  However, implementation will take significantly longer if we opt to implement it across the create/copy alarm dialogs, especially since those dialogs don't have inline charts atm.  Please advise.
Needs to be in all three spots, please. At least you can get started on the details page while you are waiting for the other ticket to get merged.

[~jloza]: I've completed implementing the alarm threshold in the chart on the alarm details page (on the GUI-2354 branch).  Could you take a quick look at that before I move on incorporating it on the create/copy alarm dialogs, as that will take much longer than the alarm details page, and I'd like feedback sooner rather than later?
hi [~kgill], I loaded your branch and looked at alarm details for the david-too instance CPU utilization alarm and the chart is blank? Chrome/osx el capitan.
[~jloza]: I just pushed a fix that handles the blank chart issue, verified it works on Chrome now.

Hi [~kgill], I look at your WIP, great start! A couple of notes:

* The threshold should not be where the chart tops out, there needs to be room always above the threshold for the metric value to be visible when it exceeds the threshold. To do this, for metrics where the range is known (for example, percentages will always top out at 100%) make the top value of the Y axis the top value in the range + 25% (rounding up to a logical thing like the next whole number, so, in the percentage example, the y axis top value would be 125). For metrics where there is no known top boundary make the top of the chart the alarm threshold +25% (rounding up to a logical thing like the next whole number, for example, if the metric value is count and the alarm threshold is 3 then the y axis would end at 4 (or maybe 5, I am terrible at math)
* for accessibility, the threshold line should be easily visually differentiated from the dimension's line in the chart without using only color, that is why the wireframe shows a dotted line. Would be great if you could do a dotted red line, please. 
* Also, there's no need to include the threshold in the legend (in either of the places the legend shows), please hide that. 

Again, awesome start! Can't wait to see the next iteration.

[~jloza]: Thanks for the feedback.  A wireframe with the specs you noted above (and others -- I'm sure there's more to add) would significantly speed up implementation of this ticket.  The wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+alarm doesn't detail any UX notes for how the alarm thresholds on charts should be designed, other than they should be a dotted red line, which they are on Safari atm. I'm still wrangling with Chrome to get the dotted line to properly display there.

[~jloza]: I've added some y-value padding to the chart above the alarm threshold when it hasn't been exceeded.  I also figured out how to get the line to appear dotted/dashed on Chrome.  The only item I'm now struggling with per your feedback is removing the alarm threshold label from the legend, as NVD3 appears to require each line series to have a label.  I've search Google and StackOverflow for suggestions, but we either lose the legend altogether or we keep it as is with all line legends displayed.

[~jloza]: This ticket is ready for another round of UX review.  

I've added the following since your last review...
- Include alarm threshold chart in create/copy alarm dialog
- Redraw alarm threshold chart when threshold is changed (on alarm details page and in create/copy dialog)

Note that although the chart is spec'd as inside an expando in the wireframe, I haven't placed it inside the expando yet to facilitate development and review.  Let me know if you'd like to move the chart inside an expando and I can do that after your review.
Passing UX review on this one, the alarm threshold really needs to be removed from the legend but I don't want that to stall this ticket from getting merged. Opened GUI-2592 to track that.
